page.title: 09W.WHITECHURCH - RECREATION.
page.content: There is, in the village, Chescombe Court, an Old People's Home run by the North Dorset District Council. Bingo and Whist Drives are regularly held there which attract many living else- where in the village. A branch of the Women's Institute meets weekly in the Village Hall which is opposite the School, They have talks on a wide variety of subjects and have frequent popular competitions testing the housewife's skills. The Dart's Club meet at the Milton Arms and the Football Club play each season on a West Farm Field. The Parish Council meet each month to keep their fingers on the pulse of the Village. Their recent concerns have included the future of the village School, the protection of trees in the area, the development of the Village and excessive and dangerous traffic speeds
